decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating advantage through card draw and mana acceleration. It features powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dack Fayden, along with efficient threats like Monastery Mentor. The deck also includes a variety of counterspells and removal spells to handle opposing threats, as well as card draw spells like Sylvan Library and Ancestral Recall to help maintain card advantage. With access to powerful Vintage staples like Black Lotus and the Moxen, this deck aims to control the game and win through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap spells and efficient creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The key strategy is to generate early advantage through card draw with spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm. Young Pyromancer is a key creature in this deck, creating multiple tokens with each spell cast. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Cabal Therapy while applying pressure with efficient threats like Jori En, Ruin Diver and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and disruptive permanents like Blood Moon. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dack Fayden to generate card advantage and manipulate the battlefield. The mana base is optimized with fast mana artifacts and land cards like Tolarian Academy to ensure the deck can cast its spells quickly and efficiently. Overall, the goal of the deck is to establish and maintain control over the game while advancing its own win conditions.

This deck aims to quickly generate a large storm count through fast mana acceleration and card draw spells, leading to a powerful finish with [[Tendrils of Agony]] or [[Mind's Desire]]. It utilizes cards like [[Dark Ritual]], [[Cabal Ritual]], and [[Yawgmoth's Will]] to generate mana, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like [[Duress]] and [[Cabal Therapy]]. The deck is designed to be fast and efficient, aiming to win the game quickly using its powerful storm payoff cards.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently search for and play Doomsday, a powerful combo card that allows the player to stack their library in a specific order to win the game. The deck includes various card draw and manipulation spells to help find and set up the Doomsday combo, as well as protection in the form of countermagic and disruption. The inclusion of Trygon Predator and Laboratory Maniac provides alternative win conditions or ways to deal with opponent threats. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and win the game in a single turn.

The main concept of this deck is to generate value and card advantage by playing a mix of powerful blue cantrips, cheap spells, and efficient threats like Monastery Mentor and Young Pyromancer. By combining disruptive elements like Cabal Therapy and Mental Misstep with countermagic, the deck aims to control the game early on and create a favorable board state. Key cards like Gitaxian Probe and Gush allow for easy card draw and manipulation, while powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and the Moxen provide ramp and acceleration. The goal is to out-value and out-tempo the opponent while gradually overwhelming them with threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of artifact ramp and control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while assembling powerful combos. By generating mana quickly with artifacts like Moxen and Sol Ring, the deck can cast game-changing spells like Ancestral Recall and Tinker. The inclusion of cards like Defense Grid and Trinisphere slows down the opponent's spells, while control elements like Tezzeret the Seeker and Dack Fayden provide card advantage and disruption. The deck aims to lock down the opponent through artifact synergies and control until it can assemble a game-winning combo.

This aggro MUD deck relies on locking down opponents with disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere, while ramping up quickly with mana acceleration from Moxen and Mishra's Workshop. It aims to overwhelm opponents with threats like Triskelion, Thought-Knot Seer, and Arcbound Ravager, using Eldrazi Temple for additional mana advantage. The deck utilizes powerful artifacts and disruptive elements to control the battlefield and pressure opponents into submission.

The primary strategy of this deck is to control the game through counter spells and removal while generating value and advantage through card draw and token production. The deck aims to protect its key creatures, such as Monastery Mentor, while disrupting the opponent's plays with counterspells like Force of Will and Mental Misstep. It also has the ability to dig through its deck quickly with cards like Gush and Dig Through Time, allowing for consistency in finding the necessary answers to win the game.

The deck is focused on using powerful creatures like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Monastery Mentor, backed up by a mix of card draw, counterspells, and removal to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By efficiently managing resources and leveraging powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, the deck aims to generate card advantage and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of card advantage and powerful threats. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, helping the deck perform well in a variety of matchups.

The deck focuses on creating and utilizing token creatures generated by Monastery Mentor and Young Pyromancer to control the game while disrupting opponents with counterspells and removal. It also includes card draw and manipulation spells to maintain hand advantage and keep up with the opponent's plays. The mana base is optimized for casting powerful spells early in the game, with access to blue and red mana sources. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo, generate advantage through tokens, and overwhelm opponents with efficient spells.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while gaining card advantage through card draw and interactions with Monastery Mentor. It utilizes powerful spells like Force of Will, Ancestral Recall, and Time Walk to control the game. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Pyroblast. The mana base is optimized for consistent mana production and includes powerful mana accelerants like Black Lotus and the Moxen. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with powerful threats and control the game until it can secure a win.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand ahead of schedule. The deck utilizes a variety of powerful control spells like Force of Will and Mental Misstep to protect its game-winning threats. Show and Tell and Sneak Attack can also be used to cheat out big threats, and cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Omniscience provide additional value and power. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful Planeswalker cards, such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Tezzeret the Seeker, to control the game. It also includes key cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Vault combo with Voltaic Key to generate card advantage and take extra turns. The deck uses counterspells like Force of Will and Mana Drain to protect its game plan while having answers like Abrupt Decay to deal with threats. The inclusion of Tinker allows for powerful artifact searches, such as for Blightsteel Colossus, to quickly close out the game.

The deck focuses on creating a fast and powerful storm combo by generating a large amount of mana through various rituals and mana rocks. It utilizes powerful draw spells and disruptive elements like Duress and Cabal Therapy to control the game and protect the combo until it can be unleashed. The key strategy is to assemble the necessary pieces quickly and efficiently to cast a spell like Tendrils of Agony with a high storm count, dealing lethal damage to the opponent in a single turn.
